level.text: Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 3 infraction:
D.C. Official Code § 47-2809 (operating a barbershop or beauty parlor without a license);

17 DCMR § 3701.9 (engaging in the practice of barbering or cosmetology when suffering from a known infectious or contagious disease unless the licensee takes appropriate precautions and uses safeguards that prevent the spread of the disease to the public);
17 DCMR § 3702.1 (a) through (g) (operating a barbershop or beauty parlor without a license or certificate of registration);
17 DCMR § 3702.2 (engaging in the practice of barbering or cosmetology before the issuance of all required licenses);
17 DCMR § 3702.2 (owning a salon or shop before the issuance of all required licenses);
17 DCMR § 3702.2 (operating a salon or shop before the issuance of all required licenses);
17 DCMR § 3716.1 (operating a salon or shop without first having obtained the appropriate business licenses, registrations, and/or certificates, except as specified in § 3721); or
17 DCMR § 3727.1 (failure to permit an inspection of the premises).
Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 4 infraction:
17 DCMR § 3716.7 (operating a salon or shop without a licensed manager on duty at all times during operating hours, except as specified in section 3721); or
17 DCMR § 3718.1 through 3718.18 (failure to comply with minimum equipment requirements in violation of public health regulations).
Violation of any provision of District of Columbia Barber and Cosmetology Regulations, 17 DCMR, Chapter 37, which is not cited elsewhere in this section, shall be a Class 5 infraction.
